\subsection{Enumeration Type Documentation}
\hypertarget{main_8cpp_acf067a9f09c2b2135f1a80d61e5eb253}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!Parser\+State@{Parser\+State}}
\index{Parser\+State@{Parser\+State}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{Parser\+State}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}enum {\bf Parser\+State}}}\label{main_8cpp_acf067a9f09c2b2135f1a80d61e5eb253}
Enumeration for each of the possible states of X\+M\+L document. These will be used extensively in the program to determine the context of a particular line of text. These states are determined by the parse function below. This was made by Prof. Jesse Heines of U\+M\+L for the 91.\+204 Computing I\+V course and is taken from that course's lecture notes. \begin{Desc}

\subsection{Function Documentation}
\hypertarget{main_8cpp_a451badf8164f3272b6421feeba7d2b7e}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!add\+Spaces@{add\+Spaces}}
\index{add\+Spaces@{add\+Spaces}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{add\+Spaces}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void add\+Spaces (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf Element} $\ast$}]{current\+Element, }
\item[{ofstream \&}]{os}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_a451badf8164f3272b6421feeba7d2b7e}
Function to add spaces to an output file corresponding with the element's level. This is simply to make the J\+S\+O\+N file more readable and does not affect the file's validity. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em current\+Element} & -\/ The current element who's level is be checked. \\
\hline
{\em os} & -\/ The output stream of a J\+S\+O\+N file. Passed by reference. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}


Definition at line 738 of file main.\+cpp.

\hypertarget{main_8cpp_a7e3cd357bd093abb5fb867b4d194a705}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!ask\+Display@{ask\+Display}}

\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_a7e3cd357bd093abb5fb867b4d194a705}
Function to as the user if they wish to have the tree building processed displayed for them. If so, the boolean 'show\+Processing' is set to true. 

Definition at line 664 of file main.\+cpp.

\hypertarget{main_8cpp_a645d602cc89c1daede29ed29ae099c1e}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!ask\+Output\+Format@{ask\+Output\+Format}}
\index{ask\+Output\+Format@{ask\+Output\+Format}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{ask\+Output\+Format}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool ask\+Output\+Format (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_a645d602cc89c1daede29ed29ae099c1e}
Function to ask the user for an output format. Currently the only optional output format is as an H\+T\+M\+L file. I considered making the J\+S\+O\+N output optional, but since that is the purpose of the current assignment, the J\+S\+O\+N file will be created no matter what. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
-\/ A boolean value that will be checked before creating the H\+T\+M\+L file of the tree. 
\end{DoxyReturn}


Definition at line 700 of file main.\+cpp.

\end{DoxyParamCaption}

As each object within the pointer had memory allocated on the heap, they must each be deleted \char`\"{}manually\char`\"{}.

Definition at line 945 of file main.\+cpp.

\hypertarget{main_8cpp_a77affb2028c25422b7db58f932d3bf1a}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!openfile@{openfile}}
\index{openfile@{openfile}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{openfile}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}int openfile (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{string}]{str\+Path}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_a77affb2028c25422b7db58f932d3bf1a}
This function opens and reads the passed text file, line by line. As each line is taken from the input file, leading white space is removed, the current state is determined by calling the 'parse' function, and the line is processed. The 'process\+Line' function will also display relevant information about the current line. As each line is processed, an element tree is created. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em str\+Path} & -\/ The name of the file to be read. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
Status flag -\/ If the current state after reading the file is not 'E\+R\+R\+O\+R', returns E\+X\+I\+T\+\_\+\+S\+U\+C\+C\+E\+S\+S. 
\end{DoxyReturn}


Definition at line 501 of file main.\+cpp.

\hypertarget{main_8cpp_a861d1c103bd2b4da4b7531659a80a53d}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!parse@{parse}}
\index{parse@{parse}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{parse}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf Parser\+State} parse (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{string}]{current\+Line, }
\item[{{\bf Parser\+State}}]{current\+State, }
\item[{string \&}]{content, }
\item[{string \&}]{tag\+Name}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_a861d1c103bd2b4da4b7531659a80a53d}
This function parses a line read from the X\+M\+L file, extracts the appropriate content and returns the determined state. The function assumes that the 'trim' function has already been applied to the line of text, removing any leading white space and/or tabs. Further assumptions are as follows\+: (1) The X\+M\+L file is well-\/formed. (2) There is at most one complete element per line. (3) All element opening tags start on new lines. (4) If there is an element closing tag, it is the last thing to appear on that line. (5) If there is no element closing tag on the same line as an element opening tag, the line has no content. (6) Attributes and their values are ignored. Much of this logic of this function is based on lecture notes of Prof. Jesse Heines of U\+M\+L for the 91.\+204 Computing I\+V course. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em current\+Line} & -\/ Most recent line read from X\+M\+L file by 'open\+File' function \\
\hline
{\em current\+State} & -\/ The current state of the parser as determined by the last line parsed. \\
\hline
{\em content} & -\/ Used to store extracted content, if applicable. Passed by ref. \\
\hline
{\em tag\+Name} & -\/ Used to store extracted tag name, if applicable. Passed by ref. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
-\/ The new parser state as determined by the algorithm in the function. 
\end{DoxyReturn}


Definition at line 137 of file main.\+cpp.

This is an experimental function to output the element tree as an H\+T\+M\+L file. This was suggested as an extra challenge for the assignment by Prof. Heines and is not part of the assignment's requirements. This is virtually identical to the algorithm in the 'display\+Tree' function.

Definition at line 752 of file main.\+cpp.

\hypertarget{main_8cpp_ae995a7e11eacb0f2af38b6dbfb694f44}{\index{main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}!write\+J\+S\+O\+N@{write\+J\+S\+O\+N}}
\index{write\+J\+S\+O\+N@{write\+J\+S\+O\+N}!main.\+cpp@{main.\+cpp}}
\subsubsection[{write\+J\+S\+O\+N}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}void write\+J\+S\+O\+N (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{{\bf Element} $\ast$}]{current\+Element, }
\item[{ofstream \&}]{os}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}}\label{main_8cpp_ae995a7e11eacb0f2af38b6dbfb694f44}
Function to output the element tree as a J\+S\+O\+N file. This a very similar algorithm to the 'display\+Tree' and 'write\+H\+T\+M\+L' functions, though with changes that allow for proper J\+S\+O\+N syntax. The function is called recursively, traversing the entire element tree and creating a matching J\+S\+O\+N structure. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em current\+Element} & -\/ The element whose children and attributes are to be written to the J\+S\+O\+N file. \\
\hline
{\em os} & -\/ The output stream to the J\+S\+O\+N file. Passed by reference. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}

A place holder \char`\"{}empty\char`\"{} element that is used to determine if the current element has been changd. This is used in the tree building and display process. Important note\+: This is N\+O\+T the root element of the X\+M\+L file or the tree.
